title: Language and Literacy Development – English Language Arts
subject: Learning Standards for Early Childhood (2024-)

document.title: Pennsylvania Learning Standards for Early Childhood PRE-KINDERGARTEN

9CAE09923275405EBD436BD51FDD8380.description: Use plurals including those which do not end in “s .”

276B7AE47442477AB1278809EB4B362A.description: Speak in complete sentences that contain more than three words .

E421DE5BF685412D99CF047544DAECD0.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English when speaking based on Pre- Kindergarten level and content.

0F5BA5529F1A45C0967269F2E5176C2D.description: Use appropriate volume to be heard by group, paying attention to inside and outside voices .

447A743E75654008892BDEA6ABE0B716.description: Talk about personal thoughts, feelings, and ideas .

A91968E2F2EB48AF9AD03291A0FEBCA1.description: Use simple sentences; express thoughts, feelings, and ideas, speaking clearly enough to be understood by most audiences.

E97F7D2BDF0D499DA3A808153E504CA6.description: PRESENTATION OF KNOWLEDGE AND IDEAS – CONTEXT

3F53A6EDE5ED492D85FBA6D93ACEDEBC.description: Use appropriate volume to be heard by group, paying attention to inside and outside voices .

568BCB39372B4FFC996A23C093A74B30.description: Talk about stories, experiences, and interests using some detail .

0F545F933E674AF1A0331BDF06AF07AD.description: Use simple sentences; share stories, familiar experiences, and interests, speaking clearly enough to be understood by most audiences.

62314E6A13EB487D82ECD244B54C918E.description: PRESENTATION OF KNOWLEDGE AND IDEAS – PURPOSE, AUDIENCE, AND TASK

F2FC4DB18CB34493B91B8E7890556220.description: Act upon or respond to simple statements and questions showing understanding of intent .

54B74E980F7A41929B5CCC063F8AAB23.description: Respond to what a speaker says to follow directions, seek help, or gather information.

043683B5F46D4B9DB770096CCF0DD234.description: Respond to a question with an answer or details related to the topic being discussed .

E4729629AB154E15B74A0BE99DB98B14.description: Answer questions about key details in a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.

0CE046D798F2469BBAD58AB4E0A6F24A.description: Pose questions related to topic being discussed .

EB8C9C92160F49319ACBCB6D5BB0F30A.description: Communicate using detail related to topic being discussed .

37DA68CA300A40DDB48A89CF8AD61B86.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

82595C0CAE194BBE92B781E4BA24215E.description: Ask adult to “write down the words” of his/her story or to his/her drawing .

91C85D08403F4C90A81A5E778E1AB9CA.description: Engage in writing opportunities including journaling .

93C4A5C65DE64E9EAFD84B673D8547C9.description: Write routinely over short time frames.

4F2EC16004EF4870BC956CF34D2B93EC.description: Relate prior experiences and learning to a current topic .

25100FB76C54402285832F0FB7698DE5.description: Respond to prompts which require reference to prior experiences .

FAD8BFA85C6F42FD906527F1864FD9A8.description: With guidance and support, recall information from experiences or books.

441FB34792704A019CF43B5B4CB0C378.description: CREDIBILITY, RELIABILITY, AND VALIDITY OF SOURCES

5647B411DB8D4E7885CA86800C57777E.description: Use a variety of resources (e .g ., adults and peers, books, digital media, maps, recipes, experts) to find new information .

2CB9384C50EF4AD3AB4871EE65C848EB.description: Ask adults for explanations or information using why, how, where, and when questions (e .g ., “Why do leaves turn colors?” “Why doesn’t Jamal like pizza?”) .

7B8E641EC6EB453E9B282C251EF0DD7C.description:
Ask questions about topics of personal
interest to gain information; with teacher guidance and support, locate information on the chosen topic.

BE3E35D69D01411080930020DC4EA73D.description: When prompted, make changes to work based on feedback

7622E925E23B48D4B55D517084E97B0B.description: Participate in discussions about their work .

BC0FE9F0142147DE892ADA191E881022.description: Understand that stories may have to be changed to make meaning more clear .

067FC4C43D4B4D91969DFE8FDD111376.description: Understand that drawings and dictations can convey meaning to an audience .

E001658221A048F391B63305F75D49B4.description: With guidance and support from adults and peers, respond to questions and suggestions, and add details as needed.

A2138F5FE1104047A695D5779D711E85.description: PRODUCTION AND DISTRIBUTION OF WRITING – WRITING PROCESS

9C252E78DFBA470FA19FD1D6863173AC.description: Attempt to reproduce own name and/or simple words, with most letters correct .

8AC58B5AB6AF4EECAEA9DE92BD2DAD86.description: Write symbols, letters, or letter-like shapes .

A159433DEF2F445BB496A4B0B69E367A.description: Respond with a logical sequence of events when asked “what” their story is about .

7AE19809FBB04D889E86ABC29FC0E2E5.description: Understand that a single event is made up of a series of smaller events that are in a sequence (before, next, end) .

9B50A0CC8D9441E882469CB4A60903AF.description: Understand that stories can be told about a single event .

78BA69AFF6434274BAB4499DB820093E.description:
Recount a single event and tell about the events in the order
in which they occurred.

9764B242F50C47C79B8A9B0207DAD33C.description: Tell adult what she/he has drawn/written about .

CC9C883EA1624464B24ADA72986D14D7.description: When prompted, provide details (e .g ., descriptive words, feelings, and thoughts of the character) to further develop a story .

88A4665C54434494B25FE7F275038DF7.description: With prompting and support, describe experiences and events.

623E9F1A80C14FFFB27B82343C48022C.description: Respond when asked “who” or “what” a story is about, and follow through when drawing about or dictating the story .

F08237F4492C46D9AAA75F36BCAD0DD1.description: Understand that “what” a story will be about refers to the sequenced events that happen to the referenced “who .”

B075F03253914CB2A60B2E89382491CE.description: Understand that “who” a story will be about refers to the person, animal, or animated object that the story will be about .

E89299CDFF4944EAAB26A0B10AB579C1.description: Establish “who” and “what” the narrative will be about.

7784A4C802754B3A98280D29B141656F.description: Create a picture about an experience or event and talk about it .

5D333A82542945C7B7F0B4B56919367E.description: Use illustration/dictation to convey meaning about an experience or event .

81E70958693D40D888882CC6D887708E.description: Dictate narratives to describe real or imagined experiences or events.

EB8C672555904804AFCB9D8B6F85397C.description: Attempt to reproduce own name and/or simple words, with most letters correct

E67D0C9018E04C09842E3F92CE989D68.description: Write symbols, letters, or letter-like shapes .

AB8A47B8E4864C9C87CCEED62739F125.description: Work with adult to create words or sentences that relate to drawings .

396877F80C1C4991863817A6982FCEE8.description: Understand that words are connected to print .

19187387BC3641D4AA75ED6846935561.description: With prompting and support, make logical connections between drawing and dictation.

17F4267B969844658405DEE994751E34.description: Tell adult what she/he will draw .

9A2CE855AE0E456D9AABE3AB9E63D75F.description: Brainstorm ideas for pictures and stories .

B0B93753435046F3841EBFECE3DCEB9C.description: With prompting and support, generate ideas to convey information.

6BAD329D9A304BB4B85805973B93263F.description: Create a picture about a nonfiction topic and talk about it .

108F6BD7B14F4345BC71CEB77DEF1373.description: With prompting and support, draw/ dictate about one specific topic.

5529874FDFD546DDA752BCF116E3A9F7.description: Create a picture about a nonfiction topic and talk about it .

3A5B22C0DF1747279549809219C7B30D.description: Use illustration/dictation to convey meaning about a particular topic .

1452B88A7A1C44A398F683921BF52AE1.description:
Draw/dictate to compose informative/
explanatory texts examining a topic.

22C9E05FB24E4DC8983A7F42B4AD527F.description: Use ideas gained in group reading activities in other daily routines, learning centers, and activities .

74729902FE3948CA9A55FC8537FDF54F.description: Respond to and build on comments from other children .

A5964A5C2FD74A9EAC8978A2C04302A7.description: Share relevant prior knowledge about text being read aloud .

0C6645C9F9714F0DB578CC0CDF752A90.description: Ask and answer questions about story or poem being read aloud .

45514057F03044F29B02439F6A906394.description: With prompting and support, actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

9853C9DA5F324EB98D443CCFC2CC46A3.description: Begin to use new vocabulary when asking questions or describing situations or objects .

696ED7FE59AD4A778795B29239CCDD8B.description: Use new vocabulary in the context of dramatic play, daily routines, and classroom conversations .

1B1E2D39AFB749ACBB5FB4A33F5168CD.description: Talk about pictures using new vocabulary words or phrases .

89E6071812A443318D6A7C33A026D7A7.description: Use new vocabulary and phrases acquired in conversations and being read to.

A8A42DA196A84C958A25DE7AF0A3456F.description: Talk about connections between familiar and unfamiliar words or phrases that mean similar things (e .g ., grass, lawn) .

D23CC1D0E8434123943910407879842C.description: Recognize words or phrases that are unfamiliar to them .

55312D4F55EC44DEAB9E409135560791.description: With prompting and support, clarify unknown words or phrases read aloud.

FF0EB0C406C148CE8A6C70ADEDF71F84.description: Participate in strategies that provide opportunities to compare and contrast the experiences of characters (e .g ., Venn diagrams, T-charts, dramatic play) .

6A3C30473D0C457CB17B03A3B8483B3F.description: Understand that characters within the same story or characters from different stories can be compared and contrasted .

D323A2367E9C44B2ADB5F7B858021FA8.description: Answer questions to compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

9EC221DF754A42AEAE59C0708E42A5CC.description: INTEGRATION OF KNOWLEDGE AND IDEAS – TEXT ANALYSIS

60DA9B29DB954CD383BBE79E23227916.description: Attach action and descriptive words to illustrations (e .g ., “That man in the yellow hat is running fast .”) .

4000ED04D5BB4948AC938E4D5B23F534.description: Describe pictures in books using detail.

C803CF73952C48CBB32849EAEAD8F9C8.description: INTEGRATION OF KNOWLEDGE AND IDEAS – SOURCES OF INFORMATION

96D7BF63A2E54FB78A79088AF36EE9A0.description: Connect prior understandings to unfamiliar words .

80AE6A6703084624BEC68C36A56944C1.description: Participate in discussions about unfamiliar words .

2F66254B9A134B1CA88C78966139065D.description: Answer questions about unfamiliar words read aloud from a story.

C5A2C0E2764A458CA9BF7B42F927DABA.description: Differentiate between real and make- believe .

A59CF46052B144FA9A1C746972E2E374.description: Tell if a text is storybook or poem .

794D156A22994A7D97073A528C0ED0B2.description: Understand that a poem consists of words arranged in patterns of sound (e .g ., rhyming words, alliteration) .

ACF1AC6B2EA448228AB96D78880D71B7.description: Understand that a storybook has characters, setting, and actions associated with words and, most often, illustrations .

275178B4BD5146949434F27FA1435199.description: Understand that different types of texts are used for different purposes .

449E15D3869F47BA87512CA997040D41.description: With prompting and support, recognize common types of text.

3FA27688AC2942F4908233B67DB6436A.description: Understand that the illustrator draws the pictures .

A545A94C904E457981EC60F18A3D2C2C.description: Understand that an author writes the story .

A74B0BAB11AD48B1ACC416E2C7450965.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story.

D6ACD800E5F341B49C767BA7DF124926.description: CRAFT AND STRUCTURE – POINT OF VIEW

4809D32B952144139ED40C4008E0053C.description: Respond to questions and prompts about characters, settings, and events during a read-aloud .

11EB2924E46C40919934194FE6489DD6.description: Demonstrate understanding that “characters” are people or animals who have a role in the story .

E8534DCE8B2D4121B7D8C9A79A359A11.description: Demonstrate understanding that “setting” is where a story takes place .

1D9235D79A3C4633A1C8D1C6325814C7.description: With prompting and support, answer questions to identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

4D3A6C196C3A4C85A5901C41B3C7BBD5.description: KEY IDEAS AND DETAILS – LITERARY ELEMENTS

39BCB1066623497498549F212C8FCB24.description: Use specific details from the story to answer questions .

043DE5AA4F904BB88FF09A85276864CE.description: Answer questions about a particular story (who, what, how, when, and where).

01C3830989D94978A580AA30C5BEA6AF.description: KEY IDEAS AND DETAILS – TEXT ANALYSIS

3F870C21BC7344FC84566E4471FD8A1D.description: Retell a story in sequential order using various materials .

630B2C8FEED34297B05C36021FCDA99E.description: With prompting and support, retell a familiar story in a sequence with picture support.

D2E5ECD9C71649DD9FA54143F34A8AC0.description: Use ideas gained in group reading activities in other daily routines, learning centers, and activities .

AC87497C8EB64691A6440AEBC30AD6C4.description: Respond to and build on comments from other children .

9CA40DE2E920437993E63C6F005A148F.description: Share relevant prior knowledge about text being read aloud .

C639FD5B2DF146B4B950856E0C85F23B.description: Ask and answer questions about text being read aloud .

9A092C2D70B34F44BB15BEF74FDC43F8.description: With prompting and support, actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

542D5BB87BF14343BA7EE4D572DB4EB3.description: Talk about connections between familiar and unfamiliar words or phrases that mean similar things (e .g ., grass, lawn) .

A30EBBF29AB6483CA9EA69BF4F1C31C2.description: Recognize words or phrases that are unfamiliar to them .

CBE74871EF4A4A588D973D422FA63D73.description: With prompting and support, clarify unknown words or phrases read aloud.

6CE11A69C87143BEBDA3D71B0D4FABFD.description: Begin to use new vocabulary when asking questions or describing situations or objects .

6FA0A32F73224C0AAD28745282A19725.description: Use new vocabulary in the context of dramatic play, daily routines, and classroom conversations .

2FBEA349EE8C41EC8DE7CF7515BE4A55.description: Talk about pictures using new vocabulary words or phrases .

C8251367C25B4AD6BAB34B5F937D94A3.description: Use new vocabulary and phrases acquired in conversations and being read to.

AD2A893B039A4BDBBF1691FD0566A73E.description: Participate in strategies that provide opportunities to compare and contrast texts and/or components of texts (e .g ., Venn diagrams, T-charts) .

20F6BEF29F7E40FEAF22BA661DF65186.description: Recognize that texts have similar components that can be compared and contrasted (e .g ., main ideas, details) .

FCDD200EE0594C53A9599D07812D5BC8.description:
With prompting and support, identify basic similarities and differences
between two texts read aloud on the same topic.

19801C8BBF164C8890C7B0513B69F85D.description: INTEGRATION OF KNOWLEDGE AND IDEAS – ANALYSIS ACROSS TEXTS

EAC7DC29E9B5443E823DE6F829203BC4.description: Describe pictures in a text in detail to answer specific questions about the text .

7B8D0DD8F8764EB39D551D6AD7801509.description: Match pictures to ideas, objects, or steps in a sequence .

3940264FCA3A4BE2B6FE9892044EC91A.description: Retell a simple sequence in a text using picture support .

E10A9C231DDC46808CC61CE888C91416.description: With prompting and support, answer questions to connect illustrations to the written word.

E738FBC98FC043F190E525CB5F1FBEED.description: INTEGRATION OF KNOWLEDGE AND IDEAS – DIVERSE MEDIA

9C7490EBD1C04AC3BA23F4393B255A34.description: Connect prior understandings to unfamiliar words .

B34A6196E6574B1B8EDF4B34AB93ECD8.description: Participate in discussions about unfamiliar words .

1725615795964D55AC5D811F2A2593CE.description: With prompting and support, answer questions about unfamiliar words read aloud from a text.

70A0494FC52B4FF7934743100AAC0C37.description: Identify the back cover of a book

E400D9D83DC640D39556A840290248DF.description: Identify the front cover of a book .

EC077F25524146B2BF4C0D9B6C17A8DD.description: Identify the title page of a book .

E9AF1AAA72064201BC7108A1201C06AA.description: Relate that texts are organized in a predictable format .

08DEE7E15F9C46EF9A3AC10B9FF508F1.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

BA2C8947F1EC49199D257119AA3BF20C.description: Choose text based on personal interests and experiences .

B60D55670B7B456EA36823DDD7D06FD8.description: Contribute relevant information to a K (know), W (what child wants to learn), L (what group learned) chart .

D2737293740F40808CB1EE0A296534CE.description: Share personal experience and prior knowledge that is relevant to the text .

7C327DF2F6CA49AEA360B5DAC62C13E6.description: With prompting and support, make connections between information in a text and personal experience.

B34A01EEB442498AA65C3361F1CF88B0.description: Answer “how” and/or “why” questions using specifics from the text .

B02C153ED9AB43B0BDD6AFFB628E997D.description: Answer “who” or “what” the text is about .

1BCCAE630F9640ADA1CD3BDF95AA50D4.description: Use specific details from the text to answer questions .

9BDD2140DCF34343922868CA9394DB32.description: KEY IDEAS AND DETAILS – TEXT ANALYSIS

30FFAF0C5A7D45BB8EA6096A4136DA31.description: Provide relevant details from a text which support a provided main idea .

87DE77ACFF984CFDABF6A0CB1752A281.description: Know that the details of a text can be used to support a main topic or idea .

9F43E3B1FD724E5C9809123FC8AAB218.description: With prompting and support, retell key details of text that support a provided main idea.

A6EDBA9B4DFF45C6BF29920752DE7ED7.description: KEY IDEAS AND DETAILS – MAIN IDEA

CED71DE33F5146099F2BC39A4ED3582A.description: Assemble letters to form words and words to form sentences and (pretend) to read the words or sentences back .

D9883339216A4FD880A2FDC5F263D152.description: Apply knowledge of letters, words, and sounds to read simple sentences .

C7D81F7B210544E39ABD4CD93F4BCF37.description: Recite rhymes, songs, and familiar text while tracking with a finger or pointer .

DB5FBDD812F849779567C2B8752BFE7F.description:
Emerging to …
Read emergent- reader text with purpose and understanding.

60AC09621DD8429D92AC3C06873908CD.description: Identify familiar words and environmental print

5D1324F93A0B4E4ABB4DD0A22D615457.description: Associate some letters with their names and sounds .

B7ECDA8434B74EC5987049A9D1D41353.description: Develop beginning phonics and word skills.

8F13F163EF2C45FE9AC735086A90DF58.description: Segment single-syllable spoken words into phonemes .

7A8454F39DED43B08B302541D54F0FB7.description: Recognize when two or more words begin with the same sound (alliteration) .

F360325872B44CCE81D3074CB92B3240.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

9505C966B7AA431DB2E3453084131BE4.description: Recognize and name some upper and lower case letters of the alphabet

D4F06C0A69FF418C85E48959811F4237.description: Differentiate between numbers and letters and letters and words .

B9FC640109FF4E22980BCACF08FC5140.description: Use pointers or finger to track print on charts, posters, environmental print or in books .
